body:
Comment 2 by **tdhutt**: 
Yeah I know you can use an external tool to do this (as you can in any language) but it
isn't very easy or elegant and it doesn't fit with go's "no complicated build system"
philosophy. It also wouldn't integrate into automatic rebuilding scenarios such as the
appengine local server for example (which is where I'm using it).

The path is a good point. I think the best thing is if it is just a relative path to the
location of the .go file that the statement appears in. E.g.

const shader string = import("../shaders/myshader.txt")
